modules.description: Computes SHA256 digests of strings and verifies RSA-PSS signatures using a provided key. Operates on raw strings and cryptographic identifiers. Used to validate signed data against a public key and to generate hash values for integrity checks.

Computes cryptographic digests from strings and wire-encoded data, and verifies signatures against a set of keys and signatures. Operates on string inputs, wire-encoded structures, and cryptographic keys and signatures. Used to validate data integrity and authenticity in secure communication protocols.

Provides functions to decode and generate RSA keys, extract metadata like creation timestamp and identifier, compute bit length, and sign data using PSS. Operates on a private key type `t` and related cryptographic data. Used for generating secure keys, verifying signatures, and handling cryptographic operations with specific RSA parameters.

Provides cryptographic verification of package integrity and authenticity using RSA-PSS-SHA256 signatures, validates signed checksums and build instructions, and enforces quorum-based signing for package-key relationships. Operates on signed metadata, cryptographic keys, and package manifests. Used to secure package distribution in opam repositories by ensuring only authorized releases are accepted.

Computes and verifies cryptographic hashes and signatures, handling both string and wire-encoded data alongside RSA keys. Supports SHA256 hashing, RSA-PSS signing and verification, and key metadata extraction. Functions operate on raw strings, cryptographic identifiers, and private key structures to ensure data integrity and authenticity. Examples include validating signed messages with public keys and generating secure RSA key pairs with specified parameters.
